title: Petroglyph National Monument: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons       Petroglyph National Monument is open year-round from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM (Mountain Standard & Daylight Savings Time). The Monument is closed on Thanksgiving Day, December 25, and January 1. May also be closed during severe weather conditions. Visitor Center: open daily 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM There are no petroglyph viewing trails available at the visitor center (Unser Blvd. NW at Western Trail). Each of the three petroglyph viewing trail systems (Boca Negra, Rinconada, and Piedras Marcadas Canyons) are a one mile to a 6.5 mile drive from the visitor center. You may opt to go to the visitor center first to receive driving directions to each of the petroglyph viewing trail systems, brochures, trail maps, and current park information. Note: The Volcanoes Day Use Area does not offer petroglyph viewing.  Boca Negra Canyon: open daily 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Last entry at 4:30 PM daily is strictly enforced. Rinconada Canyon: parking lot open daily 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Access is available sunrise to sunset by parking outside of gated parking lot. Piedras Marcadas Canyon: open from sunrise to sunset daily Volcanoes Day Use Area: open 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM daily. Access is available sunrise to sunset by parking outside of gated parking lot.
